reviewText: Out and out hilarious! Loved it!  Reminded me a bit of Woody Allen's "Zelig" though with more heart. It's a hilarious premise and I felt the era was presented very well with the casting. I also felt the special effects were incredible for such a low budget film.

My wife and I saw this along with a full length film made by an energetic and very talented couple from California in a local arts movie house. This was just the lead-in short, but it was wonderful! I won't spoil it except to say that it is the newsreel record of a very significant event in international relations and American Sports History.
(I'll give one hint: I usually don't guffaw, but I sure did watching this clever film)
Ed Hart
